content: Your window is too small to display all page contents

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a warning message when the window size is too small to display all page contents. It appears on the Breakpoint Warning component and is intended to inform users about this limitation. Translators should provide a clear and concise message that communicates this issue in various languages.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation is technically correct but sounds unnatural and overly literal. A more natural phrasing would improve the user experience.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Pəncərənin ölçüsü səhifənin hamısını göstərmək üçün kifayət etmir

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation is too literal and sounds awkward in Armenian. A more natural phrasing would be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ձեր պատուհանը շատ է փոքր էջի բոլոր բովանդակությունը ցուցադրելու համար

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'էջի բոլոր բովանդակությունը' is a bit clunky. It can be simplified.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ձեր պատուհանը շատ է փոքր էջի բոլորովին ցուցադրելու համար

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'ウィンドウが小さいため、すべてのコンテンツが表示されない場合があります' is a bit too formal and implies a possibility rather than a certainty. The English suggests the window *is* too small, preventing display. A more direct translation would be more accurate.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ウィンドウが小さいため、ページ全体の内容が表示できません

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "සියළුම පිටුවල අන්තර්ගත පෙන්වීමට ඔබගේ කවුළුව ඉතා කුඩාය" is not a natural or accurate translation of "Your window is too small to display all page contents". The structure is awkward. 'සියළුම පිටුවල' (siyalum pituwala) literally means 'in all pages', which doesn't quite convey the intended meaning.  It sounds overly literal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more natural and accurate translation would be something like: "ඔබගේ ජනෙලාව ඉතා කුඩා නිසා පිටුවල ඇති සියළු දෑ පෙන්වීමට බැරි විය හැකිය" (Obage janelawa ithama kudaya nisa pituwala athi siyalu da penvimita bari viya haduwa) - 'Your window is too small, so it may not be possible to display all contents of the page'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'прозор' (window) is correctly spelled, but may not be the most natural phrasing in this context. While technically correct, 'прозор' typically refers to a physical window.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a more general term like 'приказ' (display) or rephrasing the sentence to clarify the context. For example: 'Приказ странице је ограничена због величине прозора' (The display of the page is limited due to the window size).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While the translation conveys the general meaning, the literal translation isn't the most natural phrasing in Serbian. The English phrasing is more descriptive and emphasizes the inability to display all content. The Serbian translation emphasizes the size of the window being the limiting factor.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider: 'Не можете видети цео садржај странице због величине прозора.' (You cannot see the entire page content due to the window size.) or 'Потребан је већи прозор за приказивање целог садржаја странице.' (A larger window is needed to display the entire page content.)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Vaš prozor je previše mali da prikaže sav sadržaj stranica' is a bit literal and could be improved for clarity and naturalness. While technically correct, it's not how a native speaker would typically phrase it.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Vaš prozor je premali za prikazivanje celog sadržaja stranice.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Pencereniz tüm sayfa içeriğini görüntülemek için çok küçük' is not a perfect match for the English 'Your window is too small to display all page contents'. A more natural and accurate translation would emphasize the inability to see the entire page.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Sayfa içeriğinin tamamını görüntülemek için pencereniz çok küçük.
